column4: might as well get it right. What is the make & model of your PC?
VIA EPIA - P4PB 400 Motherboard.  Only supports 32b chipcs.
confirmed. P4 celeron, 32 bit processors
I'll can try the amd64 build, but I can't see how it can work.
which iso was it that you've already tried?
ubuntu-9.04-desktop-i386.iso
9.04 is a bit quirky. If I were you, I'd try 8.04 next....
Really?  I got the impression it was stable now.  Okay.  I'll try that too.
run it down for me one more time, cos I joined this discussion late. What exactly happens during boot?
If I try booting from the CD, I get to ash (which I don't know how to use) but no further.  This also happens if I try to do a complete install from boot-up.
If I install in Windows, or even just try installing the "boot from CD" optional program (since I can't normally), I get "wrong arch: i386 != amd64" but it continues with install for a while.
Then it starts saying "ERROR  root: [Errno 22] Invalid argument"
I'm confused. Is this a wubi install?
I'm pasting from the log here
Yes,
ok, I recuse myself. I'm not qualified to help you with wubi. Best of luck...
Thanks for trying.
if it helps, I've had good luck with vmware, and others report good results with virtualbox
Quick explanation:  vmware?  virtualbox?
emulators which run as a windows application and allow you to install & run ubuntu inside them alongside windows
most importantly, less troublesome than a wubi install...
Less troublesome = win.
why I mentioned it...
